name: Hilton Garden Inn Atlanta Downtown

reviews.text: Stayed here for several nights for a convention at GWCC. Great location for this - 2 block walk to GWCC. Very clean and well maintained. Rooms were quiet and well furnished. Front desk staff are very pleasant and helpful. Pool and fitness area are very good - outdoor & indoor pool/spa and a well equipped fitness room. The restaurant only serves a fixed-price breakfast - a simple continental buffet and cook-to-order eggs, omelets and waffles; chefs were pleasant and the food was good. But I wished they had a simpler option than the full breakfast - sometimes coffee and a muffin is all you want. Complimentary coffee in the lobby and lemonade and cookies in the afternoon was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very nice property close to GWCC, well appointed rooms & fitness/pool center.

reviews.text: Hotel is quiet in a good location. The beds aren't so comfortable though(hard mattress) and the heated pool wasn't so warm. The staff is helpful and polite. The room was spacious and very clean and the bathtub was big enough for two.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: I had no complaints as my stay was very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Loved the rooms and wish I could have stayed longer to take advantage of the pool and lounge area. The location is very convenient as well;/
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.text: A wonderful place to stay if you are sightseeing or conducting business in downtown Atlanta. Conveniently located immediately adjacent to the Aquarium, within a couple of blocks of a MARTA station and within walking distance of a number of downtown Atlanta attractions. An extremely friendly staff, Jean Marie at the front desk not only provided help over the phone but made my stay pleasant with her friendly attitude. The restaurant is not your typical HGI Great American Grill but a very nice restaurant. My new "go to" Hilton property in downtown Atlanta. Oh, an right across the street from the new College Football Hall of Fame opening next year.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, quiet rooms

reviews.text: I can't enough about how much they go out of their way here to make your stay enjoyable. Breakfast is great - and made to order - rooms are clean, with large showers and comfy beds, location is subperb, and free Internet is a bonus for the already great cost! To be greeted by name upon every visit, I feel like this is my home away from home!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, comfy rooms, and great value!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel right in the middle of all the major attractions. It is the closest hotel to the Georgia Aquarium, only a short walk away. Also close by is CNN, the Olympic park and Coca Cola. The hotel itself is very nice with modern features such as granite counters and a soaker tub. Has a mini fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee maker and a sleep number bed. The room was clean and comfortable, well worth the price we paid. There is also a fantastic seafood restaurant right in the hotel!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Within a 10/15 minute walk of the World Congress Center, Coke World, Georgia Aquarium and if you cut across the park, the Peachtree Marta station. Rooms were very clean. Staff was friendly, welcoming, and had a good knowledge of the local area. Room was VERY quiet and hotel was full. I was in town for a convention. Good place to stay if that is your reason to be in town.
reviews.title: Clean Room, Good Staff, Good Location
stay
reviews.text: This is nice hotel , and convenient to offices, shopping and dining. price is o.k for this location. it is closure to coco cola, zoo atlanta, atlanta aquarium and you can easily find any thing you want.

Would recommend this hotel as top notch in the heart of Atlanta near all sporting arenas. Clean, safe, comfortable, quiet-everything you need in a hotel. The value was great for being right in the city. Keurig in the room was a nice surprise! We were only there for a night, so I can't really say anything about the pool or exercise room.
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Inn in heart of Atlanta-great value

reviews.text: Just a note to say thank you to the GM of this hotel for going the extra mile. I was expecting a parcel to be delivered to the hotel during my stay there in September 2013. The package unforunately arrived the afternoon after my departure. Mr Harman Hall promptly responded to my query and arranged for the parcel to be delivered to South Africa at no extra cost. The package arrived in SA within 3 days of Harman locating the 'lost' parcel.
reviews.title: GM went the extra mile

reviews.text: The people were exceptional, the room was nice, and the breakfast buffet was very impressive. It was very clean (two of us are asthmatics and there was nothing to set that off like we have had happen in other hotels), and the location was wonderful. I can't brag enough about how kind the people were. Our only drawback was that the beds weren't that comfortable, but we arrived late so just slept on them any way. If we stay there again, we will definitely check out the sleep number beds first to be sure that they work. I am sure that they would take care of that if they could.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel last fall for a long weekend and had a great experience and decided to stay there again when we were in town for a Falcons game.
reviews.title: Not the same experience as before

reviews.text: Location is nice because it is right next to the aquarium and within walking distance to the Georgia Dome and CNN center. I am a bit disappointed in the selection of restaurants around the hotel. Everything seemed to either be very pricey or hard to get into, and we also realized that many places closed very early since it is in the business district and most people stay around Midtown.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit disappointed at Check-in. We had accidentally booked a handicapped King Room instead of a standard king, and while checking in they asked us if we needed the handicapped room and offered to switch us to another room to free that up in case someone needed it. We were happy to do so, but once we got to the room we realized they put us into a room that had two queen beds instead of the King that we are used to.
reviews.title: First visit to this Hilton Garden Inn, Great Location and Breakfast!

reviews.text: We also had problems that the door to our room appeared to be broken. Our key was unable to unlock the room, and after having them reset twice Orlando at the front desk sent a security guard to the room to help us. We had to wait nearly 25 minutes for security when we were told that it would only take a few minutes. The guard arrived, tried his master key, then left for another 15 minutes or so to get a device to unlock the door, then stayed to change the batteries. The next day the door continued to have the same problem and another security guard said that they would arrange for us to switch rooms so that we would not have the problem. They never did switch our rooms and we continued to have to call for help every time that we wanted into the room.
reviews.title: New Adventure

reviews.text: I found the Hilton Garden Inn Downtown ideal, clean, friendly, and nice amenities around the hotel location. Everything I have come to expect from a Hilton Garden Inn was met including nice fitness center, great pool / hot tub facilities, (first time I have seen pool cabanas to rent at a HGA), and friendly service. This hotel would be great for families too with the aquarium, world of coke, cnn, Marta, and an arcade all near by.
reviews.title: Really Great Stay (Busn or w/Family)

reviews.text: This was my first stay in Atlanta, Georgia. I was at a convention very close by. The Hilton Garden was a very nice hotel. I was greeted by a friendly staff and was asked if I needed any assistance with my bags. The room was very pleasant and clean. The best part was my bed! I am not sure what mattress they used but it was firm but added a nice comfortable feel. I have to say it was the best hotel mattress I ever slept on.
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at this particular Garden Inn on Oct. 20-21. The hotel is beautiful and elegant. The front desk staff was very accommodating, fun to talk to, and offered suggestions on places to go. When I made my reservation, I had requested a high floor if possible, and I was given a room on the very top floor, which was awesome by the way. Although, we did not eat at the restaurant, I would have liked to because it looked and smelled delicious. The property is directly across the street from the Georgia Aquarium, which was our whole reason of staying here. The room was spotless when we arrived and the terrace outdoor pool was even open, I guess it really is well heated. I look forward to staying at this hotel again on my next venture to Atlanta. Keep up the good work guys!
reviews.title: wonderful hotel, highly recommend

reviews.text: We came to Atlanta for college football game and selected this hotel because of price and closeness to the Georgia Dome. Everything at hotel was wonderful and when I asked about parking at the dome they told me that I could leave my car parked at hotel and walk to the dome
reviews.title: Wonderful stary

reviews.text: I was recently in Atlanta for a healthcare conference and wanted something close to the convention center. When i walked in the room I noticed a few things right away. The bathroom was not very clean. there were black marks on the toilette seat that I had to clean them myself. The other odd thing i noticed was that the wall unit which had the microwave and the coffee maker was tilted side ways in the middle of the room. Had no idea why. It just looked weird. Tried to straighten it but could not. It was too heavy. An hour later i bought some stuff that i wanted to put in the fridge. noticed it was unplugged. i plugged it back on and put my stuff there to eat in the morning. in less than one hour the fridge started making loud noises and i had to unplug it and throw my stuff in the garbage. It was then that i realized the unit was tilted because the person before me wanted to unplug the fridge.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay but don't expect too much

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Atlanta Downtown Hotel Atlanta
description: Contemporary interior design with stunning aquatic murals in the hotel's guest room corridors. Enjoy our many services and features such as complimentary weekday USA Today, complimentary wireless high-speed Internet access throughout the hotel, Pavilion Pantry sundry and convenience mart, complimentary business center, in-room dining, valet service, ADA accommodations, safety deposit boxes, in-room safes, self and valet parking.Heated indoor and outdoor pool, game room, laundry room.
